JK Harap Museum Sejarah Nabi Akan Jadi Ikon Wisata Religi di Indonesia
04 Nov 2019, 22:29 by Muhammad Fida Ul Haq
Jakarta - Ketua Dewan Masjid Indonesia (DMI) Jusuf Kalla (JK) menerima rombongan Yayasan As-Salamu Alayka Ayyuha An-Nabiyy terkait pembangunan Museum Sejarah Nabi. Wakil Presiden ke-12 ini berharap Museum Sejarah Nabi nantinya akan menjadi ikon wisata religi di Indonesia.
"Adanya Museum Rasulullah SAW akan menjadi ikon wisata religi baru bagi masyarakat Indonesia dan negara di kawasan Asia maupun Eropa. Lantaran lokasi yang strategis dan mudah diakses," kata JK melalui keterangan tertulisnya, Senin (4/11/2019).
JK mengatakan nantinya museum tersebut juga akan menjadi sumber informasi edukatif bagi ilmuwan Islam. Dia mengatakan museum tersebut juga bisa menjadi objek penelitian bagi yang berminat untuk mempelajari agama Islam.
"Selain berfungsi sebagai wisata religi, Museum Rasulullah juga akan sarat dengan wahana dan informasi edukatif yang menjadi objek penelitian bagi mereka yang berminat kepada studi-studi agama khususnya Islam," terangnya.


Foto: Jusuf Kalla (JK) menerima kunjungan Yayasan As-Salamu Alayka Ayyuha An-Nabiyy (dok. Istimewa)

Sementara itu, Ketua Yayasan As-Salamu Alayka Ayyuha An-Nabiyy, Abdullah Nasir Al Qarni, mengaku sangat mengapresiasi pembangunan museum itu. Pihaknya berharap banyak wisatawan yang datang usai pembangunan museum itu selesai.
"Lokasinya sangat bagus, lantaran berdampingan dengan Kampus Universitas Islam Internasional Indonesia. Diharapkan akan banyak mengudang wisatawan yang datang," paparnya.
Kunjungan itu sendiri, JK didampingi Wakil Ketua DMI Syafruddin. Museum Rasulullah nantinya akan dibangun di Cimanggis, Depok. Museum itu akan dibangun berdekatan dengan lahan Universitas Islam Internasional Indonesia (UIII).

JK Hopes that the Museum of the History of the Prophet Will Become an Icon of Religious Tourism in Indonesia
Nov 04 2019, 22:29 by Muhammad Fida Ul Haq
Jakarta - Chairman of the Indonesian Mosque Council (DMI) Jusuf Kalla (JK) received a delegation from the As-Salamu Alayka Ayyuha An-Nabiyy Foundation regarding the construction of the Museum of the History of the Prophet. The 12th Vice President hopes that the Prophet's History Museum will later become an icon of religious tourism in Indonesia.
"The existence of the Rasulullah SAW Museum will become a new religious tourism icon for the people of Indonesia and countries in Asia and Europe. Because of its strategic location and easily accessible," JK said through his written statement on Monday (11/04/2019).
JK said later the museum will also be a source of educational information for Islamic scientists. He said the museum could also be an object of research for those interested in studying Islam.
"In addition to functioning as a religious tourism, the Rasulullah Museum will also be loaded with educational facilities and information which are the object of research for those interested in religious studies, especially Islam," he explained.


Photo: Jusuf Kalla (JK) receives a visit from the As-Salamu Alayka Ayyuha An-Nabiyy Foundation (special doc.)

Meanwhile, Chairman of the As-Salamu Alayka Ayyuha An-Nabiyy Foundation, Abdullah Nasir Al Qarni, admitted that he greatly appreciated the construction of the museum. He hopes that many tourists will come after the construction of the museum is finished.
"The location is very good, because it is side by side with the Indonesian International Islamic University Campus. It is expected that there will be plenty of tourists to come," he explained.
The visit itself, JK was accompanied by Deputy Chairman of DMI Syafruddin. The Rasulullah Museum will later be built in Cimanggis, Depok. The museum will be built close to the land of the International Islamic University of Indonesia (UIII).
